history: Between The Hue and Johnson halls I was walking to class this morning around 10:30am and a man was asking me for money. I don't carry cash on me and I let him know that, but he kept following me and was begging me to use the ATM up the street at the gas station. I told him that I had class in about ten minutes and that I had to get there. I was continuously walking during this whole ordeal. When I told him this, he started reaching out to me and I backed away whenever he tried. He kept saying “I'm not preventing you from getting to class, I just need a few bucks,” all while trying to reach out towards me. When I got near Smith hall I finally had to cry to let him go away while explaining to him that I was broke too and wished I could help him. I feel like if I didn't get emotional, he would've kept badgering me and try to take my arm. I'm just asking that there are better patrols between these buildings during passing periods since beggars and homeless citizens know that students walk these streets between classes and most of us have cash and other valuables on us. I'm now buying mace to keep on me just in case since this area is also very vulnerable at night.
Thank you for contacting UCPD. I understand your concern and will pass this information on to security also next time this happens make sure you give security a call right away at 217-333-1212 .
Good evening, if at all possible, would you please provide a description of the individual?

Sure - he was about 5’9" - 5’11" and he was African American. He seemed to be in his early to mid thirties. He had brown dreadlocked hair that went just past his jaw and was wearing a white tank top with baggy jean shorts.
summary: The user was walking between The Hue and Johnson halls when a man approached them and asked for money. The user was not carrying cash and told the man that they had class in about ten minutes and that they had to get there. The man continued to follow the user and try to reach out towards them, even after the user explained that they were broke too. The user felt like if they did not get emotional, the man would have kept badgering them and try to take their arm. The user is now buying mace to keep on them just in case.
instruction: Good evening, if at all possible, would you please provide a description of the individual?
output: Sure - he was about 5’9" - 5’11" and he was African American. He seemed to be in his early to mid thirties. He had brown dreadlocked hair that went just past his jaw and was wearing a white tank top with baggy jean shorts.

history: There's a rumor going around that people going around talking about "God the Mother" could be connected to human trafficking. They wanted to meet me at a different time and place to talk to me about "God the mother". Something just seemed a bit off because I asked if they had a way I could contact them (email, phone, etc) and they started getting nervous and just asked for my phone number persistently... I ended up having to give them a fake number to get them to leave me alone. As soon as they'd turned a corner, I went to another building to study because I felt pretty uncomfortable, and I didn't hear about the human trafficking rumor until March 20th. Still not sure if it's true or not, but thought I might as well send this just in case it is serious.

history: At around 10:30 this morning there was a suspicious looking man walking around the commuter/resident lot beside John Smith. I was walking back from the library when I saw him near my car, looking underneath it. When I got a little bit closer and he noticed me watching him, he began to say something to me as he walked across the parking lot towards the sidewalk that leads to University Police Department, staying in between two cars but I cut him off and asked him why he was near my car. He hesitated so I asked again, a little more frustrated. He claimed he was with the police doing his patrols. He wasn't wearing a uniform and there was no police car around. He was a tall Middle Eastern man, wearing navy blue clothes, and a dark hat. I didn't get to see his shoes. He also had blue latex gloves on, which is what really struck me as bizarre. Since he never answered my question, I pressed to get information out of him and asked “so why were you looking under my car if I have a valid parking pass?” He responded “I don't need your car, I have two cars, baby.” I continued to walk back to my dorm and yelled at him to stay away from my car and went inside. My University Police Department and supervisor told me I should report this since we don't know who this man was and I didn't recognize him from anywhere.
She also said I should tell you guys what car I have so someone can check it out for anything weird.
summary: The user was walking back from the library when they noticed a suspicious looking man walking around the commuter/resident lot beside John Smith. The user asked the man why he was near their car, and the man claimed he was with the police doing his patrols. The man was a tall Middle Eastern man, wearing navy blue clothes, and a dark hat. The man also had blue latex gloves on, which is what really struck the user as bizarre. The user reported the incident to their University Police Department and was advised to report it to the LiveSafe dispatcher. The dispatcher confirmed the user's location and provided an estimated time of arrival for an officer.

history: Hello I would like to report something to you guys to prevent this from happening to other people. Especially to other girls/women. I am a [GPE] student. When I got out of my class at around #:## I decided to go to target across the street while I waited for my next class to start. Since I had an hour before my next class started. I was at the light to cross to [PERSON]'s when I saw a man coming towards the light to cross as well. I didn't pay much attention to him since I thought he was just going to cross the street. I crossed the street and was making my way to target when I noticed he was still behind me, following me. I continued walking, this time a little faster. I was almost to the doors to target when I felt a hand grabbing my behind. All I did was freeze there in place. My mind couldn't really react because I never thought this could happen to me. When I turned around he was already running. There was a nice couple there that saw what had happened and went to me to ask if I was ok. But by now he had already gone on his skateboard making a run for it. I understand it wasn't rape. And no I wasn't dressed provocative. I had normal pants and a tshirt on. But he still sexually harrassed me. I wouldn't want that to happen to anyone else especially knowing that middle schoolers also pass by there all the time. All I remember about the guy is that he was brown skinned. He looked homeless. His face was dirty along with his clothes. He had a dark gray sweater. Some black jeans and holding his skateboard.
Thank you for letting us know. We will be on the look out at out campus. Please call the police if you feel you are in danger.
Please let us know if you see him again on campus. Again, thank you for letting us know.
Okay will do. Thank you as well.
